question: What’s your favourite part of the Christmas story and why?
Is there something you’d like to do with God to celebrate Christmas this year?
Who is more powerful – Father Christmas or God? Why?
Lots of people get ready for Christmas in different ways—what do you think it means to get our hearts ready?

Think about your family and friends and share with God what you love most about each of them. Then ask him for some present ideas for them – an idea may pop into your mind or you may be reminded of something about them that helps you.
Do you think Jesus only came for certain people? Why or why not?
What’s the most important thing for people to understand about Christmas?
What’s one question you’d like to ask God about what happened that first Christmas?
Do you think you can celebrate Christmas if you don’t think Jesus was real?
Share with your young person what part of the Christmas story you really struggle with and ask them what they think about it
How could our family make Christmas better for someone else this year?
Why do you think God chose to come to earth as a baby?
What does Christmas show us about what God is like?
If you were visited by an angel from God, what questions would you want to ask them?
Why do you think God used dreams to help people in the Christmas story hear him?
How do you think people make space to catch from God when they’re so busy and there’s so much going on at Christmas? Why not ask an adult that you know what they do!
If you could give the world a present this Christmas, what would you choose and why?
Mary and Joseph called their baby ‘Jesus’. If you had to give him a middle name, what would you choose and why?
Why do you think God choose the shepherds to be the first people to know about Jesus?
What lullaby or song do you think baby Jesus would have liked?
What made the wise men wise?
At Christmas, people remember that Jesus is the ‘Prince of Peace’. How can we help him bring peace?
If you were one of the wise men, what gift would you want to take to Jesus?
What do you think God’s favourite part of Christmas is?
